metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5030 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Incorrect handling of complex species in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 57.0.2987.98 for Linux, Windows, and Mac and 57.0.2987.108 for Android allowed a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5030` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu1.1348
chromium-browser-l10n - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu1.1348
chromium-chromedriver - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu1.1348
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu1.1348
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu1.1348
No subscription required

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu1.1348').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
